tables.table_schema: CREATE TABLE project_budget ( project_id INT PRIMARY KEY, project_name STRING, total_budget DECIMAL, expense DECIMAL, cost_overrun DECIMAL )

CREATE TABLE projects (
 project_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
 project_name STRING,
 project_budget DECIMAL,
 start_date DATE,
 end_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE expenses (
 expense_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
 project_id UUID,
 expense_category STRING,
 expense_amount DECIMAL,
 expense_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE projects (
    project_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    project_name TEXT NOT NULL,
    start_date DATE,
    end_date DATE,
    budget DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE expenses (
    expense_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    project_id INT REFERENCES projects(project_id),
    expense_type TEXT,
    expense_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    expense_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE cost_overruns (
    overrun_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    project_id INT REFERENCES projects(project_id),
    overrun_reason TEXT,
    overrun_amount DECIMAL(10,2) NOT NULL,
    overrun_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Expenses (
 expense_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 project_id INT,
 expense_category STRING,
 amount DECIMAL,
 FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES Projects(project_id)
);

CREATE TABLE CostOverruns (
 overrun_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 project_id INT,
 reason STRING,
 amount DECIMAL,
 FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES Projects(project_id)
);

CREATE TABLE ProjectAllocations (
 allocation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
 project_id INT,
 department STRING,
 allocated_amount DECIMAL,
 FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES Projects(project_id)
);
